info.name: Stripe Webhooks
info.description:
Stripe webhook event simulators for testing payment event handling locally. This collection allows you to send simulated webhook events to your Medusa backend without making real Stripe transactions.

## How Webhook Testing Works

1. **Set your webhook secret**: Configure the `stripe_webhook_secret` environment variable with your Stripe webhook signing secret (starts with `whsec_`)

2. **Pre-request script generates signature**: Each request automatically generates a valid `Stripe-Signature` header using HMAC-SHA256

3. **Send the webhook**: The request is sent to your backend's webhook endpoint with the proper signature

4. **Backend validates and processes**: Your Medusa backend validates the signature and processes the event

## Getting Your Webhook Secret

- **Local development**: Use Stripe CLI with `stripe listen --forward-to localhost:9000/hooks/stripe` and copy the webhook signing secret
- **Staging/Production**: Get the signing secret from your Stripe Dashboard under Developers > Webhooks

## Supported Events

- `payment_intent.succeeded` - Payment completed successfully
- `payment_intent.failed` - Payment failed
- `checkout.session.completed` - Checkout session completed
- Custom events via template request

item.name: Payment Intent Events
item.description: Webhook events related to payment intent lifecycle

item.name: payment_intent.succeeded
item.description: Simulates a successful payment intent webhook event. This event is triggered when a payment is successfully completed. Use this to test order confirmation flows and payment success handling.

item.name: payment_intent.failed
item.description: Simulates a failed payment intent webhook event. This event is triggered when a payment attempt fails. Use this to test payment failure handling, retry logic, and customer notification flows.

item.name: Checkout Session Events
item.description: Webhook events related to Stripe Checkout sessions

item.name: checkout.session.completed
item.description: Simulates a completed checkout session webhook event. This event is triggered when a customer successfully completes a Stripe Checkout session. Use this to test checkout completion flows.

item.name: Custom Webhook Event (Template)
item.description:
A template request for testing any Stripe webhook event type. Modify the event type and data object to match the event you want to simulate.

## How to Use

1. Copy this request
2. Change the `type` field to your desired event (e.g., `invoice.paid`, `customer.subscription.created`)
3. Update the `data.object` to match the expected payload for that event type
4. Send the request

## Common Event Types

- `invoice.paid` - Invoice payment succeeded
- `invoice.payment_failed` - Invoice payment failed
- `customer.subscription.created` - New subscription created
- `customer.subscription.updated` - Subscription updated
- `customer.subscription.deleted` - Subscription cancelled
- `charge.refunded` - Charge was refunded
